title: Why is the Alex Murdaugh trial captivating US audiences?
description: The 54-year-old South Carolina attorney has been accused of murdering his wife and son at their rural hunting lodge.

title: Obi supporters in home state have high hopes for Nigeria election
description: Peter Obi is being projected by multiple polls to win the race to replace outgoing President Muhammadu Buhari.

title: Democrat-led states challenge US over abortion pill restrictions
description: Twelve states join a lawsuit alleging the US government has placed unnecessary restrictions on mifepristone.

title: One year into Russian invasion, Ukraine’s Zelenskyy vows victory
description: President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says the beginning of the Russian invasion was 'the longest day of our lives'.

description: A dispute with the Russian Ministry of Defence has revealed the extent of the mercenary group's role in Ukraine.

title: Winter storm brings heavy rain, rare snow to parts of California
description: Authorities warn residents that severe weather, including blizzards, could create dangerous driving conditions in US.

title: Mozambicans seek shelter as storm Freddy makes landfall
description: Heavy rains forecast in southern provinces, and neighbouring countries also expected to be impacted by tropical storm.

title: Villagers mourn mosque destroyed by Syria’s earthquake
description: 'People's hearts are attached to this mosque,' says the imam of Maland's destroyed mosque.

title: It’s time for a borderless Africa
description: No African should be treated like a foreigner in any African country.

title: All you need to know about China’s plan for Russia-Ukraine talks
description: Beijing has released a 12-point position paper, calling for a ceasefire between Kyiv and Moscow.

title: US consumer spending surges in January, inflation heats up
description: US consumer spending increased by the most in nearly two years in January amid a surge in wage gains.

title: Syrian refugees in Turkey face return to quake-stricken areas
description: Gov't directives issued after quakes allow refugees in affected provinces to move around, but only for a limited time.

title: Estonian PM: ‘If aggression pays off, aggressors will take note’
description: Prime Minister Kaja Kallas discusses what Europe has learned since last year’s invasion of Ukraine.

description: Pentagon to send more HIMARS ammunition and drones to Ukraine as Washington targets Russian firms and sanction evasion.

title: Nigeria MP arrested with nearly $500,000 before election
description: Chinyere Igwe was found travelling with the money and a distribution list, police say a day before Nigerian elections.

title: Palestinian medic’s father hit by Israeli bullet dies in his lap
description: Elias al-Ashqar cried after he could not save his father wounded in Israeli raid on Nablus on Wednesday.

description: Al Jazeera catches up with former residents of the city where Russia is alleged to have carried out atrocities.

description: An American writes about her time in the migrant prison city of Tapachula, where she is threatened with deportation.

title: Western leaders slam Russia on first anniversary of Ukraine war
description: Ukraine's allies promise to stand with Kyiv as the conflict enters a second year, while China treads a careful line.

title: Five key ways the US has supported Ukraine’s war effort
description: Al Jazeera examines Washington's notable moves to help Kyiv fight against Moscow's invasion over the past year.

title: Italy detains migrant rescue ship, fines charity
description: Italy's far-right government is taking legal action against a vessel operated by MSF in the Mediterranean Sea.

title: Tunisia arrests key opposition figure as crackdown escalates
description: Jaouhar Ben Mbarek, a critic of the president, is a prominent member of the main opposition coalition.

title: Ukraine’s Bravehearts: From filmmakers to war veterans
description: Two Ukrainian filmmakers join the army and find themselves caught between worlds.

title: Russia’s Medvedev floats idea of pushing back Poland’s borders
description: Putin-ally says Russia will be victorious in Ukraine and is ready to fight until the Polish border to counter 'threats'.

title: Israeli forces kill Palestinian, thousands protest violent raids
description: Israeli forces have killed 65 Palestinians, 13 of them children, so far this year, the bloodiest such period since 2000.

title: Ukrainians on first anniversary of Russia’s war: ‘I worry a lot’
description: Four Ukrainians in Kyiv on Russia's brutal war in Ukraine, which is barrelling into a second year.

title: Ukraine war: Is more war the only solution?
description: Two views on Russia's war in Ukraine paint different pictures of the road ahead.

title: Explainer: Key voting blocs ahead of Nigeria election
description: A close look at the four main voter constituencies and how they could affect Nigeria's upcoming election results.

title: Indonesia boosts security in Papua after 9 killed in riot
description: More than 200 security personnel sent to Wamena town after kidnap rumour sparks deadly riot and clashes with police.

title: Is Europe really united in backing Ukraine and isolating Russia?
description: Europe has shown solidarity with Zelenskyy's forces, but beneath the surface, divisions persist, say analysts.

title: Two Pakistanis leave Guantanamo after 20 years without charges
description: Abdul and Mohammed Rabbani, arrested from Karachi in 2002, are the latest inmates to be released from US custody.

title: India’s Modi asks G20 finance heads to focus on ‘most vulnerable’
description: Financial viability of many countries is being threatened by unsustainable debt, Indian PM says at two-day G20 meeting.

title: Djibouti holds parliamentary vote branded as sham by opposition
description: Only two parties are contesting seats in the 65-member National Assembly in Friday's election.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 366

description: Soyuz MS-23 will transport Russian cosmonauts Dmitry Petelin, Sergei Prokopyev and NASA's Frank Rubio back to Earth.

title: IMF unveils crypto plan, advising against legal tender status

description: China's plan calls for end to Western sanctions on Russia and humanitarian corridors for civilians to escape fighting.

title: Indonesia’s palm oil tycoon Darmadi gets 15 years for corruption

description: Pyongyang has begun conducting more weapons tests as the United States and South Korea step up military training.

title: Refugees on Australian detention island sew lips shut in protest

description: Russia’s economy has been able to weather Western-led sanctions in large part due to strong energy exports.

title: Republican Party sets first presidential debate in US swing state
description: The debate, to be held in Wisconsin, is expected to feature Republican candidates like Donald Trump and Nikki Haley.

title: UN condemns Russia over Ukraine war, calls for withdrawal
description: Some 141 members of the UN General Assembly back resolution, a year after Russia invaded its neighbour.
